intro: Psychotria thyrsoidea, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant ecological and cultural importance in the regions where it is found.
